t: Matthew 25
The Parable of the Ten Virgins
“At*rp that*r time*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r will*r be*r like*r ten*r virgins*r who*r took*r their*r lamps*r and*r went*r out*r to*r meet*r the*r bridegroom.*r
Five*r of*r them*r were*r foolish*r and*r five*r were*r wise.*r
The*r foolish*r ones*r took*r their*r lamps*r but*r did*r not*r take*r any*r oil*r with*r them.*r
The*r wise*r ones,*r however,*r took*r oil*r in*r jars*r along*r with*r their*r lamps.*r
The*r bridegroom*r was*r a*r long*r time*r in*r coming,*r and*r they*r all*r became*r drowsy*r and*r fell*r asleep.*r
“At*rp midnight*r the*r cry*r rang*r out:*r ‘Here’s*r the*r bridegroom!*r Come*r out*r to*r meet*r him!’*r
“Then*rp all*r the*r virgins*r woke*r up*r and*r trimmed*r their*r lamps.*r
The*r foolish*r ones*r said*r to*r the*r wise,*r ‘Give*r us*r some*r of*r your*r oil;*r our*r lamps*r are*r going*r out.’*r
“ ‘No,’*rp they*r replied,*r ‘there*r may*r not*r be*r enough*r for*r both*r us*r and*r you.*r Instead,*r go*r to*r those*r who*r sell*r oil*r and*r buy*r some*r for*r yourselves.’*r

“But*rp while*r they*r were*r on*r their*r way*r to*r buy*r the*r oil,*r the*r bridegroom*r arrived.*r The*r virgins*r who*r were*r ready*r went*r in*r with*r him*r to*r the*r wedding*r banquet.*r And*r the*r door*r was*r shut.*r
“Later*rp the*r others*r also*r came.*r ‘Lord,*r Lord,’*r they*r said,*r ‘open*r the*r door*r for*r us!’*r
“But*rp he*r replied,*r ‘Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r I*r don’t*r know*r you.’*r
“Therefore*rp keep*r watch,*r because*r you*r do*r not*r know*r the*r day*r or*r the*r hour.*r
The Parable of the Bags of Gold
“Again,*rp it*r will*r be*r like*r a*r man*r going*r on*r a*r journey,*r who*r called*r his*r servants*r and*r entrusted*r his*r wealth*r to*r them.*r
To*r one*r he*r gave*r five*r bags*r of*r gold,*r to*r another*r two*r bags,*r and*r to*r another*r one*r bag,*r each*r according*r to*r his*r ability.*r Then*r he*r went*r on*r his*r journey.*r
The*r man*r who*r had*r received*r five*r bags*r of*r gold*r went*r at*r once*r and*r put*r his*r money*r to*r work*r and*r gained*r five*r bags*r more.*r
So*r also,*r the*r one*r with*r two*r bags*r of*r gold*r gained*r two*r more.*r
But*r the*r man*r who*r had*r received*r one*r bag*r went*r off,*r dug*r a*r hole*r in*r the*r ground*r and*r hid*r his*r master’s*r money.*r
“After*rp a*r long*r time*r the*r master*r of*r those*r servants*r returned*r and*r settled*r accounts*r with*r them.*r

The*r man*r who*r had*r received*r five*r bags*r of*r gold*r brought*r the*r other*r five.*r ‘Master,’*r he*r said,*r ‘you*r entrusted*r me*r with*r five*r bags*r of*r gold.*r See,*r I*r have*r gained*r five*r more.’*r

“His*rp master*r replied,*r ‘Well*r done,*r good*r and*r faithful*r servant!*r You*r have*r been*r faithful*r with*r a*r few*r things;*r I*r will*r put*r you*r in*r charge*r of*r many*r things.*r Come*r and*r share*r your*r master’s*r happiness!’*r
“The*rp man*r with*r two*r bags*r of*r gold*r also*r came.*r ‘Master,’*r he*r said,*r ‘you*r entrusted*r me*r with*r two*r bags*r of*r gold;*r see,*r I*r have*r gained*r two*r more.’*r

“His*rp master*r replied,*r ‘Well*r done,*r good*r and*r faithful*r servant!*r You*r have*r been*r faithful*r with*r a*r few*r things;*r I*r will*r put*r you*r in*r charge*r of*r many*r things.*r Come*r and*r share*r your*r master’s*r happiness!’*r

“Then*rp the*r man*r who*r had*r received*r one*r bag*r of*r gold*r came.*r ‘Master,’*r he*r said,*r ‘I*r knew*r that*r you*r are*r a*r hard*r man,*r harvesting*r where*r you*r have*r not*r sown*r and*r gathering*r where*r you*r have*r not*r scattered*r seed.*r
So*r I*r was*r afraid*r and*r went*r out*r and*r hid*r your*r gold*r in*r the*r ground.*r See,*r here*r is*r what*r belongs*r to*r you.’*r
“His*rp master*r replied,*r ‘You*r wicked,*r lazy*r servant!*r So*r you*r knew*r that*r I*r harvest*r where*r I*r have*r not*r sown*r and*r gather*r where*r I*r have*r not*r scattered*r seed?*r
Well*r then,*r you*r should*r have*r put*r my*r money*r on*r deposit*r with*r the*r bankers,*r so*r that*r when*r I*r returned*r I*r would*r have*r received*r it*r back*r with*r interest.*r
“ ‘So*rp take*r the*r bag*r of*r gold*r from*r him*r and*r give*r it*r to*r the*r one*r who*r has*r ten*r bags.*r
For*r whoever*r has*r will*r be*r given*r more,*r and*r they*r will*r have*r an*r abundance.*r Whoever*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r they*r have*r will*r be*r taken*r from*r them.*r
And*r throw*r that*r worthless*r servant*r outside,*r into*r the*r darkness,*r where*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.’*r
The Sheep and the Goats
“When*rp the*r Son*r of*r Man*r comes*r in*r his*r glory,*r and*r all*r the*r angels*r with*r him,*r he*r will*r sit*r on*r his*r glorious*r throne.*r
All*r the*r nations*r will*r be*r gathered*r before*r him,*r and*r he*r will*r separate*r the*r people*r one*r from*r another*r as*r a*r shepherd*r separates*r the*r sheep*r from*r the*r goats.*r
He*r will*r put*r the*r sheep*r on*r his*r right*r and*r the*r goats*r on*r his*r left.*r

“Then*rp the*r King*r will*r say*r to*r those*r on*r his*r right,*r ‘Come,*r you*r who*r are*r blessed*r by*r my*r Father;*r take*r your*r inheritance,*r the*r kingdom*r prepared*r for*r you*r since*r the*r creation*r of*r the*r world.*r

For*r I*r was*r hungry*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r something*r to*r eat,*r I*r was*r thirsty*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r something*r to*r drink,*r I*r was*r a*r stranger*r and*r you*r invited*r me*r in,*r
I*r needed*r clothes*r and*r you*r clothed*r me,*r I*r was*r sick*r and*r you*r looked*r after*r me,*r I*r was*r in*r prison*r and*r you*r came*r to*r visit*r me.’*r
“Then*rp the*r righteous*r will*r answer*r him,*r ‘Lord,*r when*r did*r we*r see*r you*r hungry*r and*r feed*r you,*r or*r thirsty*r and*r give*r you*r something*r to*r drink?*r
When*r did*r we*r see*r you*r a*r stranger*r and*r invite*r you*r in,*r or*r needing*r clothes*r and*r clothe*r you?*r
When*r did*r we*r see*r you*r sick*r or*r in*r prison*r and*r go*r to*r visit*r you?’*r
“The*rp King*r will*r reply,*r ‘Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whatever*r you*r did*r for*r one*r of*r the*r least*r of*r these*r brothers*r and*r sisters*r of*r mine,*r you*r did*r for*r me.’*r
“Then*rp he*r will*r say*r to*r those*r on*r his*r left,*r ‘Depart*r from*r me,*r you*r who*r are*r cursed,*r into*r the*r eternal*r fire*r prepared*r for*r the*r devil*r and*r his*r angels.*r
For*r I*r was*r hungry*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r nothing*r to*r eat,*r I*r was*r thirsty*r and*r you*r gave*r me*r nothing*r to*r drink,*r

I*r was*r a*r stranger*r and*r you*r did*r not*r invite*r me*r in,*r I*r needed*r clothes*r and*r you*r did*r not*r clothe*r me,*r I*r was*r sick*r and*r in*r prison*r and*r you*r did*r not*r look*r after*r me.’*r

“They*rp also*r will*r answer,*r ‘Lord,*r when*r did*r we*r see*r you*r hungry*r or*r thirsty*r or*r a*r stranger*r or*r needing*r clothes*r or*r sick*r or*r in*r prison,*r and*r did*r not*r help*r you?’*r
“He*rp will*r reply,*r ‘Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whatever*r you*r did*r not*r do*r for*r one*r of*r the*r least*r of*r these,*r you*r did*r not*r do*r for*r me.’*r
“Then*rp they*r will*r go*r away*r to*r eternal*r punishment,*r but*r the*r righteous*r to*r eternal*r life.”*r
